DOC.brief_title: Meeting Needs Pregnant Women With PTSD Prenatal Care
DOC.detailed_description: Studies Posttraumatic Stress Disorder ( PTSD ) pregnant woman public payer setting show rate 5 time population , rate high 33 % lifetime PTSD sub-threshold symptom . PTSD pregnancy link poor prenatal care high risk behavior drug alcohol use smoking . Further , PTSD may pose barrier care obstetric procedure pregnancy may trigger PTSD symptom avoidance care . PTSD also associate pregnancy birth complication negative postpartum outcome include excessive weight gain , preterm birth , low birth weight , risk parenting problem , increase barrier breastfeed . However , screen , identification , support PTSD lacking . This study screen 750 pregnant woman risk trauma-related stress symptom , adapt test evidence-based intervention pregnant woman PTSD sub-threshold PTSD symptom serve two public payer community health center .
DOC.criteria: Mothers receive prenatal care 18 year old In first 20 week pregnancy Screen positive posttraumatic stress disorder Not pregnant Not currently psychotic No current suicidal ideation Language English , Spanish , Vietnamese , Portuguese
